result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas D Kraus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not participate in any fund raising activities.
Defendant shall participate in all counseling or treatment programs as directed by his supervising agent.

Disposition Form

Def in person & by Atty Jennifer Flynn. Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State. Second Amended complaint is on file; reading waived. Atty Flynn not objecting to the filing of the amended complaint given the late filing. Information filed and served on defendant. Def has paid up front restitution. State confirms victim rights compliance. Def pleads no contest to count #1 and #2; def is convicted and sentenced.
